title: Chapter 1 - Language Basics
text:
There are basically two methods used to print information within a program.



Method
Description




Console.Write()
Prints info on a line.


Console.WriteLine()
Prints info on a line followed by a new line.





Ex.1▶Ex.2▶


Console.Write("This is line one.");
Console.Write("This is line two.");


Ex.1 :
This is line one.This is line two.


Console.WriteLine("This is line one.");
Console.WriteLine("This is line two.");


Ex.2 :
This is line one.
This is line two.













What is a comment ?




A comment is a text note that is ignored by a program.
It helps document a program for better readability and understanding of logic.
It temporarily disables part of a program during debugging.










Types of comments




Single-line comment. Begins with /
Multiple-line comment. Begins with /* and ends with */











flowchart LR
  A[Hard edge] --> B(Round edge)
  B --> C{Decision}
  C --> D[Result one]
  C --> E[Result two]
  D --> F
